sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Account of the Consecration of Matthew Parker as Archbishop of Canterbury, 17 December 1559

p.supplied: This MS description is not part of the M. R. James catalogue; it is based in part on the description given in Vaughan and Fines, 'Handlist', p. 120.

msDesc.p: The account of the consecration is printed, with facsimile, by J. Goodwin, An account of the rites and ceremonies which took place at the consecration of Archbishop Parker, Publications of the Cambridge Antiquarian Soc. I (1841-6), no. 3.

head.title: Account of the consecration of Matthew Parker as archbishop of Canterbury, 17 December 1559

msItem.rubric: Rituum atque ceremoniarum ordo in consecrando Reuerendissimo in Christo patre Mattheo Parker Cantuariensi archiepiscopo in sacello suo

msItem.head: Matthew Parker, Commission to Walter Haddon, appointing him judge of the prerogative court of Canterbury, 27 December 1559

recordHist.p: text: typed from Vaughan and Fines 'Handlist' CF
